title: Good outing but no whales
text: The day was good and the tour was well organized in terms of punctuality and efforts to spot whales. All we saw were baby dolphins in far distance. Nothing like what is shown in pictures of the tour page.

title: Great way to explore Golden Circle in a day
text: This trip was perfect for us as we did not want to drive and were pressed for time. The bus was nice and clean and the tour was punctual. Loved the sights of golden circle with our tour guide well knowledgeable.
place: Golden Circle Classic Day Trip from Reykjavik

title: Easy and convenient way to get South Coast overview
text: The South Coast of Iceland is mesmerizing and we were pressed for time. This tour offered us a great way to be part of an organized tour. We thoroughly enjoyed this day trip. Although there is minimum flexibility in such trips, we were expecting so and were therefore not disappointed. This trip offered a good overview of the South Coast and we are planning to do a driving trip so be able to spend more time. The buses were nice and clean, our guide was knowledgebale and fun to be with. The tour was very punctual. Its a fairly long trip of 14 hours but with multiple stops, its not that we had to sit for 14 hours in the bus.
place: South Coast and Jökulsárlón Glacier Lagoon Day Tour from Reykjavik

title: Must see in Iceland
text: You haven't been to Iceland if you haven't visited this place. Loved the huge waterfall and its surroundings.

title: Loved our brunch date
text: This place is a bit pricey but totally worth going on a brunch date. The views are amazing and food pretty good. The service could do better and be more responsive but we were on a lazy brunch date so did not mind the speed of service. The open kitchen and lovely decor makes it a perfect spot for date.

title: Great ambience and service, but limited range for a brunch
text: Loved the service and ambience. We were here for a Saturday brunch. The staff and the service was par excellence. Loved the way they treat their guests. The food was great too but for a brunch place, the range was fairly limited especially in the starters section.

title: Good views but average food
text: We went here for a date lunch and were very pleased with the location and ambience. Sitting by the windows offers a romantic dining experience and the service is great. However the food did not match our expectations for a top notch restaurant. It was pretty average.

title: Best way to experience Cotswolds in a Day
text: This is an impressive tour and we got more than we had hoped for. Our driver John and guide David made the overall experience great. We had sufficient time to explore each of the 4 villages. The lunch in the Swan Hotel was well arranged and delicious.
place: Lunch in the Cotswolds Tour from London

title: Lovely Lunch at the best place in Bibury
text: We ate lunch here as part of an organized tour to Cotswolds. The staff was very welcoming and the food was delicious. The dining hall is grand and has a luxurious feel. We would definitely go back at the hotel on a personal trip.

title: Good value for money
text: Small cosy restaurant. Food is reasonably priced for the location and taste. The place could do better with cleanliness. I guess they rely more on takeaways than sit-in diners.

title: Good location and No frills Hotel
text: It's obviously a no frills hotel. The hotel is clean and bed is comfortable - that's what you need pretty much with a budget hotel. The location is also great - direct tram to airport and multiple buses to center where all the action is.

title: Easily the best Souvlaki in Santorini
text: We loved it so much we made sure we had at least 1 souvlaki each day from this place. It's freshly prepared and mouth-watering tasty. The staff is very courteous and you can have a perfect souvlaki with a perfect view of the caldera steps away from the shop.

title: Simply the best in Santorini
text: When we booked this hotel, we did not know how pleasantly surprised were we going to be! The location is simply perfect - the most photographed 3 bells church is just across the road. We got to see sunrise while lying in our beds. The hotel is conveniently located mid way between Oia and Fira. Breakfast spread is nice and comes with a splendid view. SImply loved every bit of our stay here

title: Most rude staff and pathetic restaurant
text: We wanted to eat a quick meal at 2 PM. The whole restaurant was empty but the staff did not let us sit down and eat. We were running late so to stop further wasting time in searching another restaurant, we decided to take away. At payment, the staff was so so rude - the guy kept saying the owner does not care, why should I. The owner is a millionaire sitting in Manchester and he doesn't give a damn. He kept blabbering like this the whole time. Most pathetic restaurant experience.

title: Best in Athens
text: The whole acropolis area is a must visit when in Athens. Parthenon and surrounding is full of fascinating greek mythology and history.

title: Walk in the footsteps of history
text: Acropolis is a must and possibly all you need to do in Athens. The place is remarkable and full of fantasy history. The entry fee is although expensive but totally worth it. Highly recommended for visitors to Athens

title: Must Do in Santorini
text: Perissa black sand beach is highly underrated. We loved our time here. The water in tranquil and although not suitable for swimming in April, we would easily imagine the beach full of life in high summer. There are nice places to eat and the beach itself is long and clean.

title: Breathtaking views and lovely wine
text: The USP of the place is its views. The wine was decent and the service was prompt with courteous staff. Santo Wines is easy to reach with public bus from Fira bus terminal. Definitely worth spending an afternoon.

title: Great entertainment and vibe but very average food
text: The overall ambience and the entertainment is unique and traditional. The service is great but the food was very average. We ordered the vegetarian set menu. Starters were the traditional humus with pita bread. The main course was an aubergine curry which wasn't too good. Even the dessert was a selection of ready made turkish delight and some cake. The food is definitely not worth going back.

title: Delicious Pad Thai but average thai curry
text: We stopped over for a quick meal and were surprised with communal seating arrangement - so definitely not a place for a fine dine experience. Pad Thai was mouthwatering delicious but Thai curry which my partner ordered was pretty average. Would definitely go back for the pad thai.

title: Tasty food but super slow service
text: We went here for a family dinner. The place is good and the food is authentic indian flavors. The ambience inside is great but the service is not up to the mark. Service is very slow but the food more than compensates for it. Would not mind going back again!

title: Good place for take away mexican lunches
text: I usually have my take away lunch from here. The menu is pretty standard and its delicious. Staff is courteous and fairly fast.

title: Lovely location, good food and excellent service
text: Great location and excellent service - at par with what you would expect from a Michelin star restaurant. We had the vegetarian taster menu and loved most of it barring a couple of options especially the dessert. The last course was their signature dessert which we were not impressed with and therefore only 4 stars. Loved everything else.

title: Fascinating architecture and calmness
text: Baha'i temple in Evanston is one of the few such temples in the world and it is an experience to be here. The peace and calmness is worth experiencing. The temple is beautiful with lots of beautiful landscaping around it.

title: Lovely dinner in a cosy restaurant
text: First I wish to speak about the place itself - its small and cozy and the decor inside is very traditional. The staff was courteous and the food is flavorful. The menu is reasonably priced so it is great value for money. The meze platter is mouthwatering. There is only 1 good option if you are a vegetarian but my meat loving friends were delighted.

title: Burst of Asian flavors at affordable price tag
text: This place has a wonderful vibe. So much variety at affordable price tag makes it really worth multiple visits for quick bites. The food hall is very big and although it is very crowded usually, it has a great feel of eating together with friends.

title: Great German beer but Cash-Only and limited Vegetarian options
text: We had read the reviews and it was written that this place is vegetarian friendly. To our surprise, there was only 1 main course vegetarian option on the menu. My other colleagues had a very good meal though and the beer was very authentically German. We loved the cosy feel inside but it wasn't warm enough so we had to keep our jackets on.

title: Good local dining experience
text: We went here for a business dinner and had a very good time. The service was fantastic. Menu had lots of good options and the beer was very nice. The internal ambience is pretty nice too.

title: Decent enough for a couple of night's stay
text: The rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast spread is fair and some other advantages include free parking. The furniture in the room was very old and in fact worn out. The carpet is too old and therefore blackish. So good enough for a singles night stay.

title: One of few ways great ways to experience nature in Singapore
text: The botanical gardens is vast enough to experience woods in Singapore. Although fairly close to city center, you feel isolated inside and can experience different aspects. It's very quiet so it was pretty good for a peace of mind and good walk with fresh air.

title: Tasty food but with all the husstle-busstle
text: MTR is definitely worth multiple visits for a value Indian meal. The location is convenient and food is very authentic and delicious. The only downside is that the place is generally very crowded and people are waiting in line while you are eating, so its a lot of husstle-busstle.

title: Great views, Limited menu options, Good Food and Service
text: First and foremost are the views from L-14. You get possibly the best view in Lucknow. We went for a family dinner and the range of options on the menu were fairly limited. The food itself was well made and at par with what we expected from a restaurant like L-14. I will definitely go back for the ambiance and views but I am not so sure if I will go back for the food itself.

title: Average variety on menu and below average taste
text: We went here for a family lunch. We are vegetarians and were expecting a decent variety of options on both starters and main courses. We were sad to see fairly few options - the same stuff was being repeated. That's not what you go for at a place like open buffet. I have had much much wider range of options are various other places around the world. The food itself was below average in taste. Although we had a good afternoon as a family, food did not definitely contribute to the good times.

title: A typical low cost airline
text: UIA flights are like any other low cost airline of Europe. No entertainment. On the long haul flight from Kiev to Delhi, they offer food but it is so horrible, it's best to carry your own food. For beverages, the complimentary option is only water or juice. Wine is for money. Overall, not a bad option if you just want to get through your journey with no frills.

title: Good arctic wilderness fun
text: We loved our day trip to Ranua from Rovaniemi. The zoo is well maintained with the animals well looked after. Watching Polar Bear is an experience in itself. There are several other interesting animals like white owls and reindeer which added to the experience. The whole tour takes about 3 hours to complete. The walking tour is clearly marked and so it helps to complete it without any assistance. There is a nice cafe at the entrance of the zoo and it serves good lunch options (even for us vegetarians). We simply loved our overall day trip.

title: Absolute Fun in White Snow World
text: We were first timers to a skiing and absolutely loved our experience here. We took a 90 minute ski school session. The trainer was very very helpful and kept patience with us novices. The slopes are nice for beginners. The ski resort itself is located in the heart of Lapland and its absolutely every bit worth to make a visit to experience the arctic lapland.

title: Good value meal
text: The cafe is located inside the supermarket and provides for a good value lunch meal. The menu is reasonably priced and taste is good. Not suitable for a fancy dinner but good for a value meal of the day.

title: Perfect dinner in the middle of Winter Wonderland
text: We went for dinner once and loved it so much that we went again the following evening. The place is amazing with real fireplace. The cabin restaurant is romantic and perfect for a dinner date - with white snow outside it makes for a perfect setting to sit by the window and sip red wine with your partner. The food is mouth-watering delicious. We are vegetarians and we found good options on the menu. This restaurant is a must visit on any trip to Saariselka.

title: Stunning Finish experience in the heart of Lapland
text: We stayed here for 3 nights and couldn't love it more. The location is excellent - close to all restaurants. The ski bus takes you from right in front of the cabin. The log cabins are everything you would ask for in Finland - warm and cosy and the excellent sauna. The check-in experience is a bit troublesome - you need to collect the keys from a supermarket next door. The breakfast spread is not too great either and that's why I give 4 stars. Other than these 2 issues, absolutely loved our stay here.

title: Very pricey for the service
text: The great part is that the flight takes off from London City airport which is the best part. The service onboard and the flight itself is average - more like any other low cost airline in the UK.

title: Good drinks and wonderful vibe
text: We loved this place for the value of money and a wonderful vibe for a evening with friends. There is no music so you can talk. The service is fantastic and food reasonably delicious. The best of all is that it all comes at an affordable price tag.

title: Comfortable rooms, average breakfast but good location
text: Location is the biggest advantage of this Novotel. It is next to tram station and 5 min tram journey from the area where all the offices are in Kirchberg. The staff is courteous. I did not like the breakfast spread - I have had much better spreads in cheaper hotels across major cities in Europe. The carpet in the room did not feel very clean but otherwise the room was clean. Only 2 square pillows were provided in the room which is by far below standard of a chain like Novotel. I expected much better pillows.

title: Good food and ambience
text: Bill's is a great place to have a good friday evening dinner with friends. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The ambience is nice and has a good vibe.The food istasty and well balanced in flavors - the portions are a big smaller for the price tag but you can still have a good filling meal.

title: Good music and drinks
text: We had a great time having a party with friends. The music is good. There's a good place to dance but not many people were going for it. We guessed the vibe of the people there wasn't that great maybe.

title: Luxurious and Best Views in the City
text: We were most pleasantly surprised when we entered our room - the views, the bed, the luxury and the massive bathroom. Sadly we were here only for 1 night but I would prefer to go back to this place if I have a chance for a longer stay in Bergen. The hotel is very centrally located with views of the harbor from the room. We woke up to the views of the harbor with cruise ships lined up. The famous fish market and Bryggen are a stone's throw away. The breakfast spread is great too.

title: Worst hotel experience
text: We reached at 2.30 PM to check-in (with check-in time given as 2 PM onwards) and were told that our rooms were not ready. There was a long line of people waiting in the lobby for the rooms to get ready. We were super tired and we insisted on getting a room early. We were then given a room in an adjascent building. The room was very old with crippled infrastructure. The room was super noisy with sound of traffic disturbing our sleep through the night. When we complained the following morning, we were simple told that the hotel is awaiting renovation. There wasn't even a slight sorry about our situation.

title: Insanely tough hike, Great Views in the end but not so much on the way
text: The views of the Hardanger fjord at the end of the hike makes you speechless. Period. But the overall hike is not so pleasant. The hike is insanely tough and on the way you are just walking among stones and boulders with not so mesmerizing views that we often see in various other hikes. The worst part of our hike was that there was a 3 hour long queue to take photos at the trolltunga rock.

title: Cosy place, Great Pizza but average Pasta
text: We just stumbled on this place. We saw a lot of locals eating here so assumed it to be a non-touristy locally well known restaurant. The atmosphere inside was nice and cosy with super friendly and helpful staff. I ordered a pizza and my wife ordered a Ravioli pasta. The pizza was delicious but the pasta wan't so much. Overall a satisfying dining experience in Bergen.

title: Tasty and Plentiful Thai Food at reasonable pricing
text: This place was near our hotel so we just walked into. The food is delicious and plentiful for a good lunch or dinner. The prices are reasonable by Bergen standards.

title: Good flavour and reasonable pricing
text: We liked the flavors of the thai curry. The quantity of the food was good for a hungry meal and the price was reasonable by Bergen standards. No complaints.

title: Great evening stroll and fun dining
text: It is right next to Bergen harbor and the place has a wonderful vibe with lots and lots of people eating and having a good time. Definitely worth a walk and if you fancy sea food, there's plenty to try.

title: Love the charm and history - very touristy
text: Its a wonderful walk down the alleys of history and see the old fishermen houses. Its definitely worth spending a couple of hours after a stroll along the harbor.

title: Worth the time and money and a quick overview of the Norwegian Fjords
text: This is a short 3 hour fjord cruise which gives a good glimpse to what Norwegian fjords have to offer. Definitely do it if you are in a hurry. If you have more time, go for the regular day long cruises or hike along the hardanger fjord for more surreal scenic beauty.

title: Good for quick bite, Nice charm
text: The pub is a good place to grab a quick lunch in afternoon. There aren't very many options for vegetarians but we were still able to eat a good burger lunch.

title: Delicious greek food but super slow service
text: We simply loved the food, it was our first time for greek cuisine and we absolutely loved the food. The portions were good, ingredients fresh and mouthwatering delicious. The only complain is the the service was super slow. Food took too much time to prepare - possibly because everything was being freshly prepared when ordered, which is good. But the wait for food can be a bit longer.

title: Authentic North Indian food in heart of Edinburgh
text: I ended up here for a dinner. The quality of food was very nice and the staff was very friendly. The paneer recipe is mouthwatering. Giving only 4 star because when I turned up, i did not have an advance reservation. I was told that the restaurant is full but I had to request to give me a seat for 30 mins.

title: Great day trip from London
text: We did the entire hike from Seaford to Eastbourne. Although the hike is hard, you do it in awe of the place and your surroundings. A few pubs on the way provide for a perfect breaks and refreshments. If you are into walking and hiking, this is the best spot for a good hike near London.

title: Nice Ethiopian experience
text: It's a nice hidden place that we came to learn of through friends who love this place. There are quite a few vegetarian options on the menu and are reasonably flavourful. The injera was a bit too high on vinegar so while we enjoyed the overall dinner, it needed a bit more balance of flavors.

title: Tasty and filling take-away
text: After a day spent at Bournemouth Beach, Mexigo is a perfect dinner takeaway for your return journey. The food is very tasty and portions are good and therefore make up a good dinner option. There is also seating arrangement but no table service.
